newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice ends up slightly on short-squeeze.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice ends up slightly on short-squeeze.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures closed up in active trade on Friday on short-squeezing, traders said.
The key September contract ended up at an intra-day high of 2,604 yuan ($313) per tonne, rising 32 yuan. It opened at a low of 2,595.
Combined volume rose to 18,550 tonnes from 6,100.
Traders said there was only 5,000 tonnes of inventory on the exchange, which triggered large amounts of stop loss buying.
"Sellers had not enough spot goods for delivery, which caused panic buying in the session," one trader said.
Traders said that rice will continue rising in the next few days on institutional short-squeezing.
